verses.name: Matthew 6:28
verses.text: And why take ye thought for raiment? Consider the lilies of the field, how they grow; they toil not, neither do they spin:

verses.name: Matthew 6:29
verses.text: And yet I say unto you, That even Solomon in all his glory was not arrayed like one of these.

verses.name: Matthew 6:30
verses.text: Wherefore, if God so clothe the grass of the field, which to day is, and to morrow is cast into the oven, shall he not much more clothe you, O ye of little faith?

verses.name: Matthew 6:31
verses.text: Therefore take no thought, saying, What shall we eat? or, What shall we drink? or, Wherewithal shall we be clothed?
